intro: Vriesea platynema var. wrightii, commonly known as the Wright’s Vriesea, is a striking bromeliad native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, sword-shaped leaves that form a rosette, creating a central water-holding cup. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with colorful, long-lasting bracts that range from red to orange. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity and well-draining soil. This variety is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ease of care.
